content: When I got the truck. I had a squeak coming from the bushings in my stacks Peterbilt. if you're watching this the squeaky stacks. you're telling me y'all couldn't grease those bushings when you put them together that's ridiculous brand new truck squeaking.
author: Unknown

content: Overall. it seems kind of like the the fit and finish and the build quality of the truck is is kind of poor. especially see that in the electrical system as I was just talking about with the Gremlins. and stuff but uh material wise it feels like a lot of just kind of like real cheap plastic. and that could change depending on your model I'm not sure it just doesn't it doesn't feel like you're getting your money's worth as far as materials. and the fit and finish of the truck is concerned.
author: Unknown

content: Mine came with a lovely oil leak, took 2 weeks to get the part.
author: nitrobass24

content: I'm so sorry to hear that whoever ordered your trucks didn't know to never spec piece of shit Paccars instead of X15s. Oh well, enjoy them for the 400,000 miles that they'll last before spinning cams and bearings.
author: Smart-Atmosphere4797

content: I see all those electronics and plastic pieces and all I could think is, 'that's job security for anyone who works on those because age will crack plastic and electrical shit will fail because it's Tuesday and the moon was looking a little funny.
author: Unknown

content: Good god, what a mess. Makes you appreciate the 389 and X15.
author: Bombsquad68

content: Within the 4 months, 14 out of the 22 have been sent to the shop for engine repairs. What's happening? Is it just my luck, or has peterbilt gone down hill these days?
author: Unknown

content: New Peterbilts are JUNK! Hey drivers, I need to vent for a second. 4-5 years ago we leased 22 day cab 579s, all 2016. The first year with them was great. No problems whatsoever, but after that first year, they all went down hill.
author: Unknown

content: Brand new truck tour 2024 peterbilt 579, already having problems!
